attributes.action: Change the current protocols on adjunctive treatment for cancer patients
attributes.additional_details:
I have bone and lung cancer and was expecting to start on a tablet form of chemotherapy. I am fighting for my life in this current situation, I feel I should make the decision when receiving treatment. As do many others. 
I am a person with full capacity, and with this in mind, current care pathways and protocols should be changed in order for people to have autonomy. This is achieved when a person has an operation, a patient will sign the consent forms knowing the risks.
attributes.background: NICE guidelines want to save resources and staff by not letting people with cancer receive vital treatments, therefore Drs and consultants have taken away the peoples autonomy in making their own decisions.

rejection.details:
The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence is an executive non-departmental public body, so the content of guidance produced by NICE is an operational matter for NICE, not the Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to increase funding for the treatment of cancer patients, so that they are able to access a wider range of treatments.

We have published the following petition about the care of chronically ill people, including those with cancer, during Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/313956

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
